instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-3115, C7523 Keeps Shorting Out
threads.message:
I have an 820-3115 board that originally had liquid damage. Repaired several areas of the board, including a shorted C7523 cap. Board ran well for 5 passes of ASD and 72 hours of manual testing. Worked fine for customer for a few days, then was returned because it wouldn't power on. Found C7523 was shorted, removed/replaced and board was back up and running. Ran fine for 3 days, returned to customer. Ran fine for another few days, and stopped again. C7523 was shorted out again. I can replace it and the board will work again, but what would be causing it to short out every time? I can't detect any anomalies when the board is repaired/working, everything works well.

Any ideas, duke?

threads.title: 820-3115, C7523 Keeps Shorting Out
threads.message: I see no reason for that to happen unless you are replacing it with a wrong voltage cap. The machine should also work fine without it.

threads.title: 820-3115, C7523 Keeps Shorting Out
threads.message: Same cap, pulled from the exact same spot on parts boards, actually. I'll just leave it off and see how it goes--thanks!
